content:
It sounds like you had a wonderful experience learning from your grandmother! It's great that she was patient and willing to share her knowledge with you. And I'm sure it meant a lot to her to be able to pass on her traditions and recipes to you.

Yes, Indian cuisine is all about layering flavors and textures, and chicken tikka masala is a great example of that. From the marination to the spice blends to the simmering of the sauce, it's a dish that requires patience and attention to detail. But as you said, it's definitely worth it in the end!

I love that your grandmother shared stories about her experiences making chicken tikka masala for special occasions in Mumbai. Food has a way of evoking memories and emotions, and it's wonderful that you got to connect with your grandmother on that level. It's also great that you're interested in learning more about your Indian heritage through cooking - it's a wonderful way to stay connected to your roots and cultural traditions.

Now, let's talk about the Butter Chicken recipe! Are you excited to try it out? Do you have any questions or concerns about the recipe? I'm here to help and want to make sure you have a great experience making it.
